intro: Adenostemma zakii, commonly known as the narrowleaf false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in the summer months. Adenostemma zakii is often found in dry, disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its botanical properties are not extensively documented in modern scientific literature.
